intro: Verbascum duzgunbabadagensis, commonly known as the Düzgünbaba badan grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae. It is native to Turkey and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
